ygData.subject: RE: Bards questing
ygData.msgSnippet: LOL Slyde :-P I was born in 71 and can t remember if I have seen the Day the Earth Stood Still, if I did it would have been in college too and chances are I
ygData.messageBody:
LOL Slyde :-P

I was born in '71 and can't remember if I have seen the Day the Earth Stood
Still, if I did it would have been in college too and chances are I was in
no condition to remember anything about it.

Interesting etymology though, thanks for the connection...

and I just remember that Ash says "klatu verada ni-*cough cough*" not "nicto
verada klatu"

*grin*

-Faras


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Daniel P. Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 18, 2000 10:02 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bards questing
>
>
> From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <fuzzbone@...>
>
> Psah, Evil Deal Part 3 - my you must be a young one.. True Sci-Fi
> aficionados know this phrase originated in the 1951 Classic
> "The Day the
> Earth Stood Still". This is a stunning film with serious
> cultural overtones
> regarding the Cold War and is a serious religious allegory.
> If you never
> seen it - make a point to...
>
> Slyde
> aka Dan Sniderman (my apologies - but I took a lot of film classes in
> college)
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Mike Roach" <mike.roach@...>
> To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Friday, February 18, 2000 9:33 AM
> Subject: [eqbards] Bards questing
>
>
> > From: Mike Roach <mike.roach@...>
> >
> > If you take the secret phrase and turn it backwards, you
> get "nicto verada
> > klatu" which some of you may recognize from Evil Deal part
> 3, Army of
> > Darkness. Ash has to say this phrase before he picks up
> the necronomicon
> in
> > the graveyard. It gave me a chuckle.
>
>
